newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's Prairies see little rain, cool weather.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Prairies see little rain, cool weather.

text.p: Canada's Prairies saw little rain in the last 24 hours as temperatures cooled, Environment Canada said.
None of Alberta's agricultural land saw rain in the last 24 hours while Saskatchewan's grainbelt only saw trace amounts of precipitation, meteorologist Henry Schmidt said.
About 12 mm (0.5 inch) of rain fell within a 75-km radius west of Manitoba's Red River Valley extending to the North Dakota border, Schmidt said.
An inch of rain within 24 hours is enough to delay harvest up to three days.
Alberta should see highs of 0 to 10 Celsius with snow flurries expected in the far north.
Saskatchewan should see highs of 0 to 8.0 Celsius with occasional showers or snow flurries forecast for the southwest.
Manitoba should see highs of 0 to 7.0 Celsius with a mix of sun and cloud.
